label: 武徳殿
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Located in the northwest of the Burakuin wall; a hall from which the Emperor observed horse races, archery contests, and similar exercises on the Court's annual calendar of ceremonial events.  It differed from most Palace buildings in that it had no surrounding walls (p. 837). [豊楽院]
